article: Pete Rose was a great baseball player. Though I have never met him, he taught me something _ that changed my life. Pete was being _ in spring training the year he was about to break Ty Cobb's all-time hits record. Suddenly one reporter asked him, "Pete, you only need 78 hits to reach your nearest _ . How many at-bats do you think it'll take you to get the 78 hits?" Without hesitation, Pete just _ at the reporter and said,"78." The reporter yelled back, "Ah, come on, Pete, you don't think you'll get 78 hits in 78 at-bats, do you?" Mr. Rose calmly _ his philosophy(,) with the reporters who were _ waiting for his reply to the claim. "Every time I _ up to the plate ,I _ to get a hit! _ I have it in mind,I have no right to step into the batter's box! It is _ expectation that has enabled me to get all of the hits in the first place." When I thought about Pete Rose's _ and how it applied to everyday _ ,I felt a little embarrassed. As a business person,I was hoping to increase my _ . As a father,l was hoping to be a good dad. As a married man,I was hoping to be a good husband. The truth was that I was a fairly good salesperson,I was not so _ a father,and I was an okay husband. I immediately decided that being okay was not _ ! I wanted to be a great salesperson,a great father and a great husband. I _ my attitude to a positive one,and the results were _ .I was fortunate enough to win a few sales trips,I won Coach of the Year in my _ baseball league,and I share a loving relationship with my wife,Karen,with whom I am _ to enjoy the rest of my life! Thanks ,Mr. Rose!
